channel.title: Andrew Russell - Musician
channel.itunes:subtitle: Compositions, recordings, improvisations and more
channel.itunes:author: Andrew Russell
channel.itunes:summary: Songs, albums, compositions, improvisations, mini concerts and everything else music.

item.title: Farther Away
item.description:
The intro is set during the not-so-far-distant future in a region of the world that is being hit hard by climate change. The local farmers are struggling to grow their crops, leaving them with little money. Because of this, they have to turn to other means to survive.
Farther Away starts with a mother lamenting about her living conditions. She recently sold her only daughter so that she would have enough money to struggle out a living. It has finally sunk in that she will never get to see her daugter again.
This song is supposed to segue directly into Here We Are, but I just didn't record the demo that way for whatever reason.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Here We Are
item.description: Ah, so here we are. The intro is done and here comes the bulk of Act I. This song introduces the four themes found in this act.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Boy
item.description: We now fast forward a few years and find ourselves in a richer part of the world. Life looks great, families are well fed, well educated, and well entertained. This songs introduces to the protagonist of our story; a Boy in his senior year of highschool. He sings about his issues as he struggles to maintain a relationship.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Parents
item.description: We follow the Boy as he arrives home after school. His father is there waiting for him, upset that he is so late. His father berates him for not working towards finding a career path as the Boy complains that he isn't given enough space. After being chewed out, the Boy overhears his mother questioning how they are raising their child.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Friends => The Meeting
item.description:
This is both song 5 and 6, as they flow directly into one another. The Boy, being banished to his room, complains to his friends while he does his school work. His friends try to pressure him to sneak out late at night to have some fun. The Boy is conflicted, not wanting to disobey even more, but eventually caves in and follows them out.
Fast foward to later that night, the Boy and his friends are up to no good. They wind up at a whore house where his friends ask the Madam to treat him well. The madam takes the Boy to their newest possession, the Girl sold in the first song.
This is the closing song of Act I.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Losing => Looking Back
item.description:
The intro to Act II goes back to the mother of the Girl. Life has not gotten any better after selling her daughter. Their town is in ruins due to recent floods and there is no help in sight.
Looking Back starts off the main part of Act II which is a flashback of what happend to the Girl after she was sold. It introduces the four themes found in Act II.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Owner
item.description: The Girl, recently being sold, is introduced to her new owner. He tells her what her life will now be like, as she as terrified about what is happening.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Escape
item.description: One of the other slaves she lives with attempts to make an escape and pulls the Girl along. She is thrilled about getting away, but at the same time, she is terrified about being caught. The worst happens, and they are caught. The Girl quickly burst out crying that she was forced to go along. The owner lets her off the hook as he big plans for her, but the Girl never sees the other slave again.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Dusty Road
item.description:
Note: Please don't listen to this song. My narration is terrible. Like... so bad that I'd like to blot it out of my memory entirely. Saying that...
The new job for the girl is a sex scam. She attracts rich tourists who think they can have it all while her Owner bursts in their room before anything can happen and blackmails them for their money. The Girl is being well treated and fed during all this and her determination to make something out of her life grows.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Lost Soul
item.description: Nothing good lasts for long. The Girl is sold to the whorehouse where the Boy found her. Once again, the Girl's life is throw to tatters and she loses all hope that she will ever have a good life.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: New Life
item.description: Flash back over, we are back in the present. After recounting her life to the Boy, she wants to just be left alone. The Boy refuses, wanting to help her out. He realises that he has to do something about this problem and vows to dedicate his life to it.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Impromptu 3
item.description: This one takes a while to get going, but it really gets going
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Impromptu 2
item.description: Starts off with Peace by Horace Silver
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Home Concert - 2020-05-17 - Solo Piano
item.description:
Notturno - Edvard Grieg
Here's That Rainy Day - Jimmy Van Heusen
Improv - Andrew Russell
Three To Get Ready - David Brubeck
(Up a) Lazy River - Hoagy Carmichael
Quiet Nights of Quiet Stars (Corcovado) - Antônio Carlos Jobim
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Home Concert - 2020-05-10 - Solo Piano
item.description:
Improv - Andrew Russell
Ruby, My Dear - Thelonius Monk
Waltz for Debby - Bill Evans
Georgia on My Mind - Hoagy Carmichael

Lazy Bones - Hoagy Carmichael
Blue in Green - Bill Evans
Improv - Andrew Russell
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Has That Ever Crossed Your Mind
item.description:
Straight up 3min Rock Song in 6/8
I wrote this song while riding a bike. In fact, I wrote a second song on that bike ride as well. Life is silly sometimes.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Moving
item.description: Simple rock song followed by relaxed composed section ending with a trippy jam.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: The Pensive Pest
item.description: This one came out of [[song:fawm_2017.the_electric_tapes|The Electric Tapes]] from [[album:fawm_2017|FAWM 2017]]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Waiting for the Sky to Fall
item.description: One of my finest compositions, both from a lyrical and musical point of view.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Once Majestic
item.description: Grand solo piano composition. This is the first composition done primarily at the grand piano.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Labour of Love
item.description: Was wanting to do my yearly DADGAD song late one night when I got the idea for this one, but it had more of a morning feel to it so I waited until the next morning to write it!
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Lone Roamer
item.description:
Wanted to write an acoustic grunge song, but this came out instead.... I'll find that grunge song one day.
I asked a few others to help name this song. They all independently said it was about traveling / roaming / adventuring / something similar. How odd.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Elegy of Fear
item.description:
Got inspired by a Rachmaninoff Elegy Op. 3 No. 1, so I wrote something in that style.
This took 3-4 long days of writing and still could use tons of work, but... FAWM. Also, my playing sucks, I had to record a lot of this one hand at a time... then heavily edit those sections as well. Huzzah for MIDI!
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Trafilata al Bronzo
item.description: Jumped into my head just a few hours before I had to catch a plane. 100% FAWM quality. Yet another song where I had to ask what to name it / what genre / how to describe it. No definitive answers. If you know where this names come, I guess you like pasta?
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Variations on a Theme of Raindrop Prelude (Chopin)
item.description:
Composed with my brother, Christopher Russell.
Theme from Chopin - Raindrop Prelude
https://youtu.be/HVau-JRGirg
Variations are around the theme from 1:42 - 2:42
https://youtu.be/HVau-JRGirg?t=102
Variations are a type of composition where you start with an already written piece of music (in our case, the above theme), then write original pieces that modify the original theme, are influenced by it, or are just similar to it in some way that may or may not make sense to the listener.
For example, you could take a single note melody line from the original theme, and then put it to a different set of chords using a different rhythm. Or take some rhythmic pattern from the original theme and write a new theme that is based off of that rhythmic pattern. The possibilities are endless!
Here is a Rachmaninoff: Variations on a Theme of Chopin (a different Chopin theme!). It is well worth the listen.
https://youtu.be/XiDtLscGnn8
Performed by myself. Err... mostly. Kind of. Every note here was played on a piano. Just... usually really slowly, and one hand at a time. Or sometimes even multiple takes for a single hand. And then edited heavily after that.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell
item.itunes:author: Christopher and Andrew Russell

item.title: Prelude in F Minor
item.description:
There's just something about me and manhattans when it comes to piano. It just changes how I write piano music.
Anyhoo, regular disclaimer that I "played" this piece. Aka, one hand... err... one part of one hand at a time. Then made lots of edits. So don't go claiming I'm great at playing piano after listening to this.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Impromptu 1
item.description:
8 minutes cut out of a 30 minute improv session. It sounded so much like a piece already composed that I decided to upload it verbatim here. Will probably go back and give it some more coherence at some point.
Multiple (3 or 4) themes from this same improv session went on to become [[song:fawm_2020.rhapsody_of_uncertainty|Rhapsody of Uncertainty]].
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Seed into Tree
item.description: Yet another FAWM collab with the wonderful Hummingbear. I managed to rope my wife into singing one yet again! (And by that, I mean she wanted to sing to these lyrics 😀)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell
item.itunes:author: Nancy Gunderson, Kristen Machina and Andrew Russell

item.title: Dance of the Dead
item.description:
My morning songs always seem to end up happier than my other songs. Its weird considering that I usually write them before I have my coffee...
I just picture dancing skeletons when listening to this, and there's definitely some Garcia and Grisman influence poking through. Hence the title.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Back to Frozen
item.description: This is me rushing to finish 14. Except I needed help for some brilliant lyrics.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell
item.itunes:author: Adnama17 and Andrew Russell

item.title: Seeking an End
item.description: Well, I hit 14... not much else to say about this one. ...well, other than most of this came from that same 30 min piano improv session. Could probably turn it into something much better than this, but not with the time remaining in FAWM!
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: The River
item.description: A through composition. I really like how it ends, but the opening half hasn't aged well in my opinion.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Manhattan Sessions
item.description: There's just something about manhattans opening up my piano creativity. Hence this 20 min improv extravaganza. There are a number of distinct sections. I used to have names and timestamps for them all but... no clue where they went.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Kiddy Pool
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell
item.itunes:author: David L Graham and Andrew Russell

item.title: Morning Meadow
item.description: An exploration into DADGAD. One guitar. Many layers.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: The Spicy Burrito Saga
item.description: Following up on the Manhattan Sessions, I decided to try a similar concept with other instruments. Here's 10 minutes of acoustic guitar improv. There are four distinct sections.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: The Electric Tapes
item.description: Part three of the improv tour. This time the electric guitar makes it's appearance. This is probably my least favourite of the bunch, but has churned out one of my favourites in [[song:misc.the_pensive_pest|The Pensive Pest]].
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: The Basement Gallery
item.description: 4 of 5 done. Bass guitar. So low. So smooth. So go.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Meandering Musings
item.description: Out of instruments, I have a different take on the improv. I start with an acoustic guitar track, 100% improv. Then layer the bass, then keys, then electric guitar. Every take improv'd and every take done without listening back to what I did previously. It was... fun!
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Mellow Song
item.description: There are lyrics for this. I swear. I just don't know what happened to them and they were never completed...
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Riding Past
item.description: Original poem titled "Riding Past" by Pat Lowther
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: The Journey
item.description: This song has gone on to be one of my more commonly played ones, both live and recorded.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Epic Story
item.description: This song was originally written for a grade 12 English project. It was about the elements of an epic.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Change
item.description: I think I wrote 0.5 - 1 lines of lyrics before I decided I didn't like them.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: I See
item.description: Partially inspired by one of my favourite books at the time, World Without End by Sean Russell (no relation).
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Deleted
item.description: I originally wrote this using my digital piano's recording feature. I then accidentally deleted it and didn't realize until over a week later. I then had to rewrite this from memory. Hence the name.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell

item.title: Now
item.description: One of my favourites still to this day. It deserves a higher quality recording.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russell
